author.organization: Internet Services Project, Information Networks Division

abstract.t: The TFTP option negotiation mechanism, proposed in, is a backward-compatible extension to the TFTP protocol, defined in. It allows file transfer options to be negotiated prior to the transfer using a mechanism which is consistent with TFTP's Request Packet format. The mechanism is kept simple by enforcing a request- respond-acknowledge sequence, similar to the lock-step approach taken by TFTP itself.
This document was written to allay concerns that the presence of options in a TFTP Request packet might cause pathological behavior on servers which do not support TFTP option negotiation.
